attributes.title: How the app scared me for life.
attributes.review:
If 0 stars was an option, then this review would have 0 stars. 
When I opened the app, it showed a picture of an orange with a face. It looked similar to trumps. There were no buttons, just an orange. I tapped all over the screen until it changed. A question was displayed that asked, " Are you alone? " I immediately got super suspicious and somewhat scared. But I was in fact, alone. So I answered truthfully and pressed "Yes". Nothing changed. I guess I must have clicked wrong? I pressed "Yes" again. And again. And again. Nothing. "Alright what the hell is going on with this app?". Suddenly my house lights flickered. In a matter of seconds, they shut off. I almost peed my pants. I was extremely anxious and scared, I didn't know why they turned off all of a sudden. I thought the best thing to do was to delete the app in case anything was going on. So I immediately looked at my phone... but it was shut off. The battery couldn't have died, right? It was at 69% before I downloaded the app. I held the power button to turn it on. But nothing happened. Then I heard something in the kitchen fall. A small object, like a fruit. I quickly dropped my phone, turned to look at my door, and ran. I went straight to the kitchen to check out the noise. I looked everywhere to find what small object fell, but everything was fine. I stood in complete darkness looking all around me. I knew something was going to happen. Out of a sudden, I felt a pain in my back. I jumped and looked back to see what hit me. And on the floor, was an orange. A small orange the size of my palm. I blinked to see if it was real. But now, there were two. I blinked again, three. Again, four. And soon enough, there was a pile of them. I backed up quickly, but they rolled closer to me. "No.. No... NO!" I blacked out. 
When I woke up, I was on my bed. I checked my phone to see if the app was still there. It was gone. I immediately hid my phone under my pillow and closed my eyes. I felt a pain in my arms and legs as I lay flat. I didn't even bother to look. Soon after, I dozed off. In my mind was this question: What the hell just happened.
